query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
1 O voi che siete in piccioletta barca, 2 desiderosi d’ascoltar, seguiti 3 dietro al mio legno che cantando varca,
query.error: **English:** 1 O you who are in a tiny boat, 2 desiring to listen, following 3 behind my ship that sails singing,
query.result: 1 Eala ġē, ðe on lytlum bate, 2 wilniað tō hlystanne, folgiað 3 æfter mīnum scipе ðe singende ferð,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
4 tornate a riveder li vostri liti: 5 non vi mettete in pelago, ché forse, 6 perdendo me, rimarreste smarriti.
query.error: **English:** 4 turn back to see your shores again: 5 do not put out into the deep sea, for perhaps, 6 losing sight of me, you would remain lost.
query.result: 4 gewendeð tō geseonne ēowre land eft: 5 ne settað ēow on þone dēopan sæ, forðæm ðe ġif, 6 mē forlǣtende, ġē bēoð forlorene.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
7 L’acqua ch’io prendo già mai non si corse; 8 Minerva spira, e conducemi Appollo, 9 e nove Muse mi dimostran l’Orse.
query.error: **English:** 7 The water that I take has never been sailed before; 8 Minerva breathes, and Apollo guides me, 9 and the nine Muses show me the Great Bear.
query.result: 7 Þæt wæter þe ic nime næfre ær neorn, 8 Me þæt blæst and Appollo læt, 9 and nigon Musan me ða Myrcan tæcað.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
10 Voialtri pochi che drizzaste il collo 11 per tempo al pan de li angeli, del quale 12 vivesi qui ma non sen vien satollo,
query.error: **English:** 10 You few who have raised your heads 11 in good time to the bread of the angels, of which 12 you live here but are not yet satisfied,
query.result: 10 Ge ða lytle ðe ðone sweoran arærdon 11 on ðam forman timan to ðam engla hlafe, ðæs ðe 12 her libbað and na ðeah genoh habbað,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
13 metter potete ben per l’alto sale 14 vostro navigio, servando mio solco 15 dinanzi a l’acqua che ritorna equale.
query.error: **English:** 13 you can set your ship on the high seas, 14 following my furrow 15 before the water levels out again.
query.result: 13 magon nu ðurh ðone hean heall 14 eowre ceol lædan, minum folge secgende 15 beforan ðam wætere ðe eft wyrðeð gelicost.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
16 Que’ glorïosi che passaro al Colco 17 non s’ammiraron come voi farete, 18 quando Iasón vider fatto bifolco.
query.error: **English:** 16 Those glorious ones who sailed to Colchis 17 did not marvel as you will do, 18 when they saw Jason become a plowman.
query.result: 16 Þa wuldorfullan þe to Colcum ferdon 17 ne wundrodon swa swa ge willað, 18 ða hie Iason gesawon to burigene weorðan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
19 La concreata e perpetüa sete 20 del deïforme regno cen portava 21 veloci quasi come ’l ciel vedete.
query.error: **English:** 19 The innate and perpetual thirst 20 of the misshapen kingdom bore us on, 21 swift as you see the heavens.
query.result: 19 Seo geworhte and ða ece ðurst 20 ðæs unhiwan rīces us bær, 21 swifte swa ðu ðone heofon gesihst.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
22 Beatrice in suso, e io in lei guardava; 23 e forse in tanto in quanto un quadrel posa 24 e vola e da la noce si dischiava,
query.error: **English:** 22 Beatrice was above, and I gazed up at her; 23 and perhaps in the time that an arrow rests 24 and flies and leaves the bowstring,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
25 giunto mi vidi ove mirabil cosa 26 mi torse il viso a sé; e però quella 27 cui non potea mia cura essere ascosa,
query.error: **English:** 25 I saw myself arrived where a wondrous thing 26 turned my face toward it; and therefore she 27 to whom my desire could not be hidden,
query.result: 25 ic geseah me cumen ðær wundorlic ðing 26 me awende ðone andwlitan to him; and ðurh ðæt 27 ðære ne mihte min geornfulnes beon bediglod,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
28 volta ver’ me, sì lieta come bella, 29 «Drizza la mente in Dio grata», mi disse, 30 «che n’ha congiunti con la prima stella».
query.error: **English:** 28 turned to me, as joyful as she was beautiful, 29 and said, "Direct your mind gratefully to God, 30 who has joined us with the first star."
query.result: 28 gewende to me, swa bliðe swa heo wæs fæger, 29 "Arær ðinne geðoht to Gode ðancfulne," heo cwæð, 30 "se ðe hæfð gecnytt us mid ðære forman steorran."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
31 Parev’ a me che nube ne coprisse 32 lucida, spessa, solida e pulita, 33 quasi adamante che lo sol ferisse.
query.error: **English:** 31 It seemed to me that a cloud was covering me, 32 bright, dense, solid, and polished, 33 like a diamond that the sun was striking.
query.result: 31 Þuhte me ðæt an wolcn me oferwreah, 32 beorht, þicc, and heard and hrusanlic, 33 swilce se deman[t] ðe sunne onscineð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
34 Per entro sé l’etterna margarita 35 ne ricevette, com’ acqua recepe 36 raggio di luce permanendo unita.
query.error: **English:** 34 Through itself the eternal pearl 35 received it, as water receives 36 a ray of light, remaining united.
query.result: 34 Þurh hi sylfe ða ecan ða margaritan 35 onfeng, swa wæter onfehð 36 leoman leohtes, wuniende on annesse.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
37 S’io era corpo, e qui non si concepe 38 com’ una dimensione altra patio, 39 ch’esser convien se corpo in corpo repe,
query.error: **English:** 37 If I was a body, and here it is not conceivable 38 how another dimension could contain it, 39 which must be if body enters body,
query.result: 37 Gif ic wæs lichama, and her nis naht oncnawen 38 hu ðæt an ðæt oder mæg oninnan habban, 39 ðæt beon sceal gif lichama on lichaman gæð,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
40 accender ne dovria più il disio 41 di veder quella essenza in che si vede 42 come nostra natura e Dio s’unio.
query.error: **English:** 40 it should kindle in us a greater desire 41 to see that essence in which it is seen 42 how our nature and God were united.
query.result: 40 ðonne sceolde us ðæs wilnunga ma geweaxan 41 ðæt we ða gesawon on ðære gesyhðe 42 hu ure gecynd and God wæron an.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
43 Lì si vedrà ciò che tenem per fede, 44 non dimostrato, ma fia per sé noto 45 a guisa del ver primo che l’uom crede.
query.error: **English:** 43 There shall be seen what we hold by faith, 44 not demonstrated, but made known in itself, 45 in the manner of the first truth that man believes.
query.result: 43 Þær mon mæg geseon ðæt we gelefað ðurh geleafan, 44 unasecgendlic, ac hit bið self cuð 45 on ðære wisan ðæs forman soðes ðe man gelefeð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
46 Io rispuosi: «Madonna, sì devoto 47 com’ esser posso più, ringrazio lui 48 lo qual dal mortal mondo m’ha remoto.
query.error: **English:** 46 I answered: "My Lady, as devoutly 47 as I can be, I thank him 48 who has removed me from the mortal world.
query.result: 46 Ic andwyrde: "Hlæfdige, swa georne 47 swa ic mæg beon geornor, ic ðancige him 48 se ðe me fram ðissum deadlican life alysde."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
49 Ma ditemi: che son li segni bui 50 di questo corpo, che là giuso in terra 51 fan di Cain favoleggiare altrui?».
query.error: **English:** 49 But tell me: what are the dark marks 50 on this body, which down there on earth 51 make others tell tales of Cain?».
query.result: 49 Ac secgaðme: hwæt synd ða sweartan tacna 50 ðyses lichaman, ðe ðær on eorðan niðe 51 wyrcað ðæt men secgað saga of Caine?».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
52 Ella sorrise alquanto, e poi «S’elli erra 53 l’oppinïon», mi disse, «d’i mortali 54 dove chiave di senso non diserra,
query.error: **English:** 52 She smiled a little, and then said to me, "If the opinion of mortals errs, 53 where the key of understanding does not unlock, 54 certainly the arrows of amazement should no longer pierce you,
query.result: 52 Heo ða gelome læsse hwile, and ða cwæð to me, "Gif hit bið 53 ðara deadlicra gesceaft ðæt hi misþencað, 54 ðær ðæs andgites cyning ne unlocð,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
55 certo non ti dovrien punger li strali 56 d’ammirazione omai, poi dietro ai sensi 57 vedi che la ragione ha corte l’ali.
query.error: **English:** 55 since you see that reason has clipped its wings behind the senses.
query.result: 55 ne ðurfon ðe ða wundorstræla leng wyrcan 56 ðurh ða wundrunge, nu ðu ðurh ða gesceafta gesyhst 57 ðæt ðære gesceadwisnesse ða fyðru sind besceorene."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
58 Ma dimmi quel che tu da te ne pensi». 59 E io: «Ciò che n’appar qua sù diverso 60 credo che fanno i corpi rari e densi».
query.error: **English:** 58 But tell me what you think about it yourself." 59 And I: "I believe that what appears different to us up here 60 is caused by the bodies being rare and dense."
query.result: 58 Ac sege me ðæt ðu ðe self ðence pencst." 59 And ic: "Þæt ðe her uppan syndrig tó ðinceð 60 ic wene ðæt ða ðing ðurh ða ðiccan and ða ðunnan ða gescyld habbað."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
61 Ed ella: «Certo assai vedrai sommerso 62 nel falso il creder tuo, se bene ascolti 63 l’argomentar ch’io li farò avverso.
query.error: **English:** 61 And she: "Certainly you will see your belief 62 submerged in falsehood, if you listen well 63 to the argument that I will make against it.
query.result: 61 And heo: "Soðlice ðu gesyhst ðinne geleaffan 62 on ðæm leasum besuncen, gif ðu wel gehyrð 63 ða andsware ðe ic ðær ongean wyrce."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
64 La spera ottava vi dimostra molti 65 lumi, li quali e nel quale e nel quanto 66 notar si posson di diversi volti.
query.error: **English:** 64 The eighth sphere shows you many 65 lights, which in what and how much 66 can be noted as having different faces.
query.result: 64 Se eahtoða speora ðe æteowð mænige 65 leoht, ða ðe on hwam and on hu miclum 66 mæg man gesceadan ðurh mislice andwlitan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
67 Se raro e denso ciò facesser tanto, 68 una sola virtù sarebbe in tutti, 69 più e men distributa e altrettanto.
query.error: **English:** 67 If they did this rarely and densely, 68 there would be only one virtue in all, 69 distributed more and less and equally.
query.result: 67 Gif ðæt seldon and ðicce ða ðing wæron, 68 ðonne wære an miht on eallum, 69 mare and læsse and efenlice.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
70 Virtù diverse esser convegnon frutti 71 di princìpi formali, e quei, for ch’uno, 72 seguiterieno a tua ragion distrutti.
query.error: **English:** 70 Diverse virtues must be the fruits 71 of formal principles, and those, except for one, 72 would follow your reasoning destroyed.
query.result: 70 Mislice mægna moton wæstmas beon 71 frumra gesceafta, and ða, buton anum, 72 fylgdon ðinum ræde forworpene.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
73 Ancor, se raro fosse di quel bruno 74 cagion che tu dimandi, o d’oltre in parte 75 fora di sua materia sì digiuno
query.error: **English:** 73 Yet, if the cause of that darkness were rare, 74 which you ask about, or elsewhere in part, 75 this planet would be so empty of its matter
query.result: 73 Gyf hit ðonne seldcwen sy ðæs wonnan 74 ðæs ðu fregnest, oððe elles hwar, 75 ðonne wære ðeos tungol ðæs digol,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
76 esto pianeto, o, sì come comparte 77 lo grasso e ’l magro un corpo, così questo 78 nel suo volume cangerebbe carte.
query.error: **English:** 76 This planet, or, just as it divides 77 the fat and the lean in a body, so this 78 would change pages in its volume.
query.result: 76 Þeos steorra, oððe swā swā hē todǣleð 77 ðone fætan and ðone lēnan on anum lichaman, swā ðeos 78 on his bōce awende word.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
79 Se ’l primo fosse, fora manifesto 80 ne l’eclissi del sol, per trasparere 81 lo lume come in altro raro ingesto.
query.error: **English:** 79 If the first [cause] were [the cause of the eclipse], it would be evident 80 in the eclipse of the sun, by shining through 81 the light as in another rare medium.
query.result: 79 Gif ðæt forma wære, wære hit gesýne 80 on ðære sunnan áðiestrunge, ðurh ðæt hit scínende wære 81 ðurh ðæt leoht swá ðurh óðer ðynne gesceaft.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
82 Questo non è: però è da vedere 83 de l’altro; e s’elli avvien ch’io l’altro cassi, 84 falsificato fia lo tuo parere.
query.error: **English:** 82 This is not: but it is to be seen 83 of the other; and if it happens that I break the other, 84 your opinion will be falsified.
query.result: 82 Þis nis: ac hit is to geseonne 83 ðæs oðres; and gif hit gelimpð ðæt ic ðæt oðer tobrece, 84 ðin dom bið awend.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
85 S’elli è che questo raro non trapassi, 86 esser conviene un termine da onde 87 lo suo contrario più passar non lassi;
query.error: **English:** 85 If it is that this rare thing does not pass beyond, 86 there must be a limit from which 87 its opposite does not let it pass any further;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
88 e indi l’altrui raggio si rifonde 89 così come color torna per vetro 90 lo qual di retro a sé piombo nasconde.
query.error: **English:** 88 and from there the other ray is reflected 89 just as color returns through glass 90 which hides lead behind it.
query.result: 88 and ðanon ðæs oðres leoma eft cyrreð 89 swilce ðurh glæs færð wederleoht 90 ðe æfter him bly bewrigen hæfð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
91 Or dirai tu ch’el si dimostra tetro 92 ivi lo raggio più che in altre parti, 93 per esser lì refratto più a retro.
query.error: **English:** 91 Now you will say that the ray shows itself darker there 92 than in other parts, 93 because it is refracted there more obliquely.
query.result: 91 Nu ðu sægst ðæt ðæt leoht síene swiðor ðýstre 92 ðær ðonne on oðrum stowum, 93 forðæm ðe hit bið gebrocen swiðor on bæc.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
94 Da questa instanza può deliberarti 95 esperïenza, se già mai la provi, 96 ch’esser suol fonte ai rivi di vostr’ arti.
query.error: **English:** 94 From this perplexity experience can free you, 95 if ever you try it, 96 which is accustomed to being the source of the streams of your arts.
query.result: 94 Of ðysum tweonunge ðe mæg alysan 95 andgit, gif ðu hyt æfre onfandast, 96 ðe bið oft ðara woda wyllspring ðara ðe ðu wyrcst.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
97 Tre specchi prenderai; e i due rimovi 98 da te d’un modo, e l’altro, più rimosso, 99 tr’ambo li primi li occhi tuoi ritrovi.
query.error: **English:** 97 You will take three mirrors; and remove the two 98 from you in one way, and the other, more removed, 99 between the first two your eyes will find.
query.result: 97 Þrīe speglas þu scealt niman; and ðā twegen ahebban 98 fram ðē on āne wīsan, and ðone ōðerne, māre feor, 99 betwux ðām forman þīne ēagan ġefindað.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
100 Rivolto ad essi, fa che dopo il dosso 101 ti stea un lume che i tre specchi accenda 102 e torni a te da tutti ripercosso.
query.error: **English:** 100 Turning to them, make sure that after the hill 101 there is a light for you that kindles the three mirrors 102 and returns to you reflected from all of them.
query.result: 100 Gewend ðu ða to ðæm, wyrc ðæt ðe æfter ðæm hrycge 101 beo ðær leoht ðe ða ðreo speglas ontende 102 and eft to ðe cume of ðæm eallum awend.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
103 Ben che nel quanto tanto non si stenda 104 la vista più lontana, lì vedrai 105 come convien ch’igualmente risplenda.
query.error: **English:** 103 Although the farthest sight does not extend 104 so far in quantity, there you will see 105 how it is necessary that it shine equally.
query.result: 103 Þeah ðe on ðam micclan swa fela ne síe 104 ðæs fyrrestan gesihðes, ðær ðu gesihst 105 hu hit gedafenað ðæt hit efen scíne.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
106 Or, come ai colpi de li caldi rai 107 de la neve riman nudo il suggetto 108 e dal colore e dal freddo primai,
query.error: **English:** 106 Now, just as under the blows of the hot rays 107 of the sun the subject remains stripped of snow, 108 and of its color and its coldness at first,
query.result: 106 Nu, swa swa ðurh ðara hatan leoma 107 ðære sunnan bið snaw forweorpen, 108 and of ðam hiwe and of ðam hrusan ærest,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
109 così rimaso te ne l’intelletto 110 voglio informar di luce sì vivace, 111 che ti tremolerà nel suo aspetto.
query.error: **English:** 109 so, having remained in your intellect, 110 I wish to inform you with such vivid light, 111 that it will tremble before you in its aspect.
query.result: 109 swa ðu on ðinum mode ðurhwunnen, 110 ic ðe wille mid ðære beorhtan leohte gefrætewian, 111 ðe ðe on ðære ansyne bifiende bið.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
112 Dentro dal ciel de la divina pace 113 si gira un corpo ne la cui virtute 114 l’esser di tutto suo contento giace.
query.error: **English:** 112 Within the heaven of divine peace 113 revolves a body in whose virtue 114 the being of all its content lies.
query.result: 112 Binnon ðam heofone ðære godcundan sibbe 113 gæð an lichama on ðære mihte 114 ðæs wæs eal his willan wæs on wununge.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
115 Lo ciel seguente, c’ha tante vedute, 116 quell’ esser parte per diverse essenze, 117 da lui distratte e da lui contenute.
query.error: **English:** 115 The following heaven, which has so many stars, 116 that being is divided into different essences, 117 drawn from it and contained by it.
query.result: 115 Se heofon ðe ðærof is, ðe ða steorran hæfð, 116 ðæt ðæt an wæs todæled on mislice wisan, 117 fram him todæled and fram him gehealden.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
118 Li altri giron per varie differenze 119 le distinzion che dentro da sé hanno 120 dispongono a lor fini e lor semenze.
query.error: **English:** 118 The other circles, through various differences, 119 the distinctions that they have within themselves, 120 dispose their ends and their seeds.
query.result: 118 ða oðre hringas ðurh mislice todælas, 119 ða todælas ðe hi binnan him sylfum habbað, 120 gedælað heora endas and heora sæda.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
121 Questi organi del mondo così vanno, 122 come tu vedi omai, di grado in grado, 123 che di sù prendono e di sotto fanno.
query.error: **English:** 121 These orders of the world proceed in this way, 122 as you can now see, from grade to grade, 123 taking from above and making below.
query.result: 121 Þas worulde gesceafta swa wuniað, 122 swa ðu nu geseon miht, of stede in stede, 123 ðæt hi of ufe nimð and niðer lætað.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
124 Riguarda bene omai sì com’ io vado 125 per questo loco al vero che disiri, 126 sì che poi sappi sol tener lo guado.
query.error: **English:** 124 Look again now how I go 125 through this place to the truth that you desire, 126 so that afterwards you may know how to keep the ford alone.
query.result: 124 Loca nu ðu wel hu ic fare 125 ðurh ðisne stow to ðære soðan ðe ðu wilnast, 126 ðæt ðu ðonne syððan cunne ðone wad anforð gangan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
127 Lo moto e la virtù d’i santi giri, 128 come dal fabbro l’arte del martello, 129 da’ beati motor convien che spiri;
query.error: **English:** 127 The motion and the virtue of the holy circles, 128 like the art of the hammer from the blacksmith, 129 must derive from blessed movers;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
130 e ’l ciel cui tanti lumi fanno bello, 131 de la mente profonda che lui volve 132 prende l’image e fassene suggello.
query.error: **English:** 130 and the heaven which so many lights make beautiful, 131 from the profound mind that revolves it 132 receives its image and makes of it a seal.
query.result: 130 and se heofon þe swa fela leoht fægre wyrcað, 131 of þam deopan geþance þe hine hweorfað 132 nimð þa ansyn and wyrceð him to insegle.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
133 E come l’alma dentro a vostra polve 134 per differenti membra e conformate 135 a diverse potenze si risolve,
query.error: **English:** 133 And just as the soul within your body 134 through different and conforming members 135 resolves itself into diverse powers,
query.result: 133 And swa swa se sawl innan eowrum lichoman 134 ðurh mislice limu and gemetfæste 135 on mislice mihta bið todæled,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
136 così l’intelligenza sua bontate 137 multiplicata per le stelle spiega, 138 girando sé sovra sua unitate.
query.error: **English:** 136 so its intelligence spreads out its goodness 137 multiplied through the stars, 138 revolving itself upon its unity.
query.result: 136 swa ðæs hehstan gesceafte godcundnysse 137 gemenigfyld ðurh steorran stæfgefæste 138 ymbhygð hire self on hire annesse.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
139 Virtù diversa fa diversa lega 140 col prezïoso corpo ch’ella avviva, 141 nel qual, sì come vita in voi, si lega.
query.error: **English:** 139 Diverse virtue makes diverse alloy 140 with the precious body that it enlivens, 141 in which, just as life in you, it is bound.
query.result: 139 Mislicu miht mislice gemencð 140 mid ðam deoran lichaman ðe heo geliffæst, 141 on ðam heo gebunden is, swa swa lif on ðe.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
142 Per la natura lieta onde deriva, 143 la virtù mista per lo corpo luce 144 come letizia per pupilla viva.
query.error: **English:** 142 Through the joyous nature from which it is derived, 143 the power mixed through the body shines 144 like joy through a living pupil.
query.result: 142 ðurh ða gesæligan gecynd ðe heo of com, 143 seo mægenmenged ðurh ðone lichaman leohteð 144 swa swa blis ðurh lifiende eage.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
145 Da essa vien ciò che da luce a luce 146 par differente, non da denso e raro; 147 essa è formal principio che produce,
query.error: **English:** 145 From this [the sun] comes that which appears different from light to light, 146 not from dense and rare; 147 it is the formal principle that produces,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
148 conforme a sua bontà, lo turbo e ’l chiaro».
query.error: **English:** 148 in accordance with its goodness, the storm and the clear weather.
query.result: 148 ðurh his godcundnysse gewyrceð.
